description: One of the most popular lovebird species, they are mostly green with a beautiful rosy-pink face and throat. They are known for their big, feisty personalities.
temperament: Feisty, energetic, and curious. They can be very affectionate but are also notoriously territorial and can become nippy, especially females. They are very social with their owners.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. They have a high-pitched, repetitive chirp that can be quite loud and frequent, especially when excited or calling for attention.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for talking. Their vocalizations are a series of high-pitched chirps and squawks. They can mimic household sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet is the foundation. Supplement daily with fresh vegetables and a very small amount of fruit. Avoid all-seed diets.
healthPointers: Generally hardy with a lifespan of 15-20 years. Prone to fatty liver disease if on a high-fat diet, and psittacosis. Females can sometimes have issues with egg-laying.
housing: Can be challenging for apartments due to noise. They need a cage that is wider than it is tall, with plenty of toys. Minimum 24"W x 18"D x 18"H.
